info.label: Software Engineer
info.brief: Second year UCL Theoretical Physics student (1st expected); Self taught intermediate programmer (Python, Mathematica); Freelance Web Developer; Representative for 200 Physics students
info.quote: Be the change you want to see in the world.

projects.title: Intergrated Engineering Challenge #2: Global Health
projects.summary: A university project where a a multi-disciplinary team of specialist engineers  formulate, design and verify an effective strategy for the production and distribution (and monitoring) of a vaccine to combat a Tuberculosis Pandemic in Sub Saharan Africa.
highlights: Designed and developed a control system for the temperature, pH, and stirring of a bio-reactor.
Developed in C and Processing on a Launchpad microprocessor.
Liaised with engineers from other disciplines on specifications and requirements.

history.summary: Developed full stack, responsive websites for my clients.
Addressed clients issues with their finances and resolved their concerns with investments. Improved my communication skills through the high pressure environment of finance sales.
Launched  social media presences and designed advertising campaigns that increased my clients' following by over 60%.
Diagnosed and troubleshooted networking and technical issues at the IT department of an office of 50 employees.
Repaired and serviced ATVs, jetskis, and snowmobiles at the mechanical department of the BRP Service Center.

history.title: Theoretical Physics
history.summary: Achieved a grade of 75% in my first year.
highlights: Practical Mathematics and Computing (Python and Mathematica): 84%

history.summary: Helped raise €5365 over two charity events (October - December 2014)

speaking.title: Delegate of Iran
speaking.summary: A simulation of the United Nations, done by students from various schools as they discuss and try to find solutions to current world problems.
highlights: Debated and discussed issues in a formal UN-like setting.

speaking.title: Member of Medical Ethics committee
speaking.summary: An annual weekend conference where young people between the ages of 15-19 from schools convene to discuss and express themselves on current affairs.
highlights: Debated and discussed various ethical issues in the medical field.

speaking.title: Speaker
highlights: Gave a speech on how no particles ever really touch as a consequence of the electromagnetic force.
